sentences.en: 1877 -- Thomas A. Edison has a phonograph playing.
sentences.cn: 1877年 —— 托马斯-A-爱迪生发明留声机.

sentences.en: American inventor Thomas Edison, who was considered the father of sound recording, developed the phonograph in 1877, the first device to record music in the world.
sentences.cn: 被誉为录音之父的美国发明家托马斯·爱迪生于1877年发明了留声机，这是世界上第一台录音设备。

sentences.en: Edison is credited with the invention of the phonograph.
sentences.cn: 留声机的发明应归功于爱迪生。

sentences.en: He heard the tinny phonograph bleating as he walked in.
sentences.cn: 他步入室内时听到那架蹩脚的留声机在呜咽.

sentences.en: He invented not only the phonograph, but the entire sound recording industry.
sentences.cn: 他不仅发明了唱机, 而且还有整个录音工业.

sentences.en: In 1877, inventor Thomas A. Edison announced the invention of his phonograph.
sentences.cn: 1877年的今天, 发明家托马斯.A. 爱迪生宣布发明了留声机.

sentences.en: Let me have the key to our car, I'll go for a phonograph and some records.
sentences.cn: 把汽车的钥匙给我, 我去拿唱机和唱片.

sentences.en: Music will be played on a phonograph.
One of his first experiments after the telephone bettered the phonograph.
sentences.cn: 他在发明电话后首次的一项实验中,改善了留声机的品质.

sentences.en: Put a record on the phonograph and let's have some music.
sentences.cn: 在留声机上放张唱片,我们来听点音乐 吧.

sentences.en: The bed was rumpled and strewn with phonograph records.
sentences.cn: 那张床上凌乱不堪,散放着一些唱片.

sentences.en: The sound that came out of the talking machine, or phonograph was quite weak.
sentences.cn: 从这种会说话的机器即留声机中传出的声音很微弱.

sentences.en: We played cards and listened to the phonograph.
We recorded music on a phonograph.
sentences.cn: 我们在留声机上录下了乐曲.
